unnormalised: ## Music Streaming: Is Your Ears' Playlist Feeling the Bollywood Heat?
normalised: ## Music Streaming: Is Your Ears' Playlist Feeling the Bollywood Heat?

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Let's talk music – specifically, how we're all glued to music streaming these days. Remember the days of painstakingly ripping CDs (or even cassettes, Gen Z, Google that!) and organizing your MP3 collection? Those days are long gone, thanks to the likes of Spotify, Gaana, JioSaavn, and Apple Music.
normalised: Hey everyone! Let's talk music – specifically, how we're all glued to music streaming these days. Remember the days of painstakingly ripping C D's (or even cassettes, Gen Z, Google that!) and organizing your M P three collection? Those days are long gone, thanks to the likes of Spotify, Gaana, JioSaavn, and Apple Music.

unnormalised: Now, you can access millions of tracks, from Lata Mangeshkar classics to the latest bangers from Badshah, all with a few taps on your phone. It’s like a never-ending Sangeet ceremony happening in your pocket!
normalised: Now, you can access millions of tracks, from Lata Mangeshkar classics to the latest bangers from Badshah, all with a few taps on your phone. It's like a never-ending Sangeet ceremony happening in your pocket!

unnormalised: But seriously, the convenience is undeniable. Remember that awkward silence at aunty Sharma's Diwali party when the aux cord failed? Now, you can curate a playlist on the fly and save the evening, all thanks to streaming.
normalised: But seriously, the convenience is undeniable. Remember that awkward silence at aunty Sharma's Diwali party when the aux cord failed? Now, you can curate a playlist on the fly and save the evening, all thanks to streaming.

unnormalised: The impact on the music industry has been huge. While artists get paid fractions of a rupee per stream (more on that financial jungle later!), it's also given independent artists a platform to reach audiences they never could have before. Think about that guy you saw playing acoustic guitar at a cafe in Hauz Khas Village - he probably has his songs on Spotify now.
normalised: The impact on the music industry has been huge. While artists get paid fractions of a rupee per stream (more on that financial jungle later!), it's also given independent artists a platform to reach audiences they never could have before. Think about that guy you saw playing acoustic guitar at a cafe in Hauz Khas Village - he probably has his songs on Spotify now.

unnormalised: I was just reminiscing the other day about how *Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge* sparked a whole new generation’s love for Bollywood melodies. Now, someone halfway across the world can discover "Tujhe Dekha Toh Yeh Jaana Sanam" and fall in love with it instantly, thanks to these platforms.
normalised: I was just reminiscing the other day about how *Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge* sparked a whole new generation's love for Bollywood melodies. Now, someone halfway across the world can discover "Tujhe Dekha Toh Yeh Jaana Sanam" and fall in love with it instantly, thanks to these platforms.

unnormalised: Even institutions like the Film and Television Institute of India (FTII) are exploring how streaming is impacting filmmaking and music integration. It’s all about the algorithms, baby!
normalised: Even institutions like the Film and Television Institute of India (F T I I) are exploring how streaming is impacting filmmaking and music integration. It's all about the algorithms, baby!

unnormalised: So, are you Team Spotify or Team Gaana? Or maybe you're still loyal to your old MP3 player (no judgment!). Let me know in the comments what you're listening to and how music streaming has changed your listening habits. Also, tell me your go-to Bollywood streaming playlist! Happy listening!
normalised: So, are you Team Spotify or Team Gaana? Or maybe you're still loyal to your old M P three player (no judgment!). Let me know in the comments what you're listening to and how music streaming has changed your listening habits. Also, tell me your go-to Bollywood streaming playlist! Happy listening!
